result.execSummary:
The defendant Demarco C Wade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of extended supervision in 15CF74. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demarco C Wade

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated October 22, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP001169 CRNM (2015CF000074) and 2016AP001170 CRNM (2015CF001701), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 7, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgments are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney  Brian C. Hagner is relieved of further representation of Wade in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated September 7, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2016AP1169-CRNM (2015CF74) and 2016AP1170-CRNM (2015CF1701), IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Brian C. Hagner is relieved of any further representation of Demarco C. Wade on appeal. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order affirming

records.addlTxt: per order dated July 30, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2016AP1169-CRNM (2015CF74) and 2016AP1170-CRNM (2015CF1701), IT IS ORDERED that the hold in these matters is lifted and the proceedings under WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32 (2015-16) may continue.

per order dated March 8, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2016AP1169-CRNM (2015CF74) and 2016AP1170-CRNM (2015CF1701), IT IS ORDERED that these appeals are held in abeyance pending supreme court resolution of State v. Freiboth, No. 2015AP2535-CR. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within ten days after the supreme court either resolves Freiboth or denies the certification in that matter, Attorney Hagner shall so notify the court and shall seek appropriate relief.
received and filed.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Veronica W.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with 15CF74 with credit for 223 days time served.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of extended supervison in 15CF74.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Demarco C Wade in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Court unable to proceed to sentencing on today's date due to court calendar congestion.
Statements to the Court by Veronica W.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Demarco C Wade not in court, defendant in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Attorney Krejci called and informed the clerk he is having car trouble and cannot appear.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Demarco C Wade not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Statements made by Veronica W.  Court modified the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Demarco C Wade in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. 
.
AS TO COUNT 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Deft to have no contact with Veronica W.  Order signed and filed.  rmm
No firearms or dangerous weapons.

Defendant Demarco C Wade in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Demarco C Wade in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
